examples: the contingent nature of the job

adjective.description: Occurring or existing only if (certain circumstances) are the case; dependent on.
examples: resolution of the conflict was contingent on the signing of a ceasefire agreement

noun.description: A group of people united by some common feature, forming part of a larger group.
examples: a contingent of Japanese businessmen attending a conference

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense of uncertain occurrence): from Latin contingere befall, from con- together with + tangere to touch. The noun sense was originally something happening by chance, then a person's share resulting from a division, a quota; the current sense dates from the early 18th century.
